lcInstruction.p: A DITA key has two parts: a name and a definition. The name is used by any DITA topic or map that needs to use the key. The key defintion is a string of text, which can be be used in two ways. The key definition can represent:

ul.li: A word or phrase in text
A path to a resource (such as a DITA topic, an image file, or a URL)

lcInstruction.p: The ultimate purpose of keys is to help you to create reusable topics. Instead of hard-coding strings and paths in your DITA topics, your topic indicates keys by their names. Each map that references your topic can create a map-specific definition for each of the keys.

For instance, you might create a reusable topic that uses two keys:
k_product_name, which contains the name of a product
k_product_image, which contains the path to a picture of the product
In the map for Product A, k_product_name could be defined as “Product A” and k_product_image as “images/ProductA.png”.
In the map for Product B, k_product_name could be defined as “Product B” and k_product_image as “images/ProductB.png”.

When your topic is used in the map for Product A, the product name “Product A” is used and the product image shows the correct product. When your topic is used in the map for Product B, the correct product name and image are show for that product.
